_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Duda Farm Fresh Foods RMP Executive Summary

General Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances:
Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of A. Duda & Sons, Inc., owns and operates fresh vegetable processing, cold storage, and shipping facilities at their 6000 Duda Road, Belle Glade, Florida location. This location is known as the Belle Glade “Packing Facility”.
   
Dandy Cooling, Inc., a partnership of A. Duda & Sons, Inc. and Western Precooling Systems, Inc., leases and operates those portions of the Packing Facility where anhydrous ammonia is used in closed loop refrigeration systems to cool and store the fresh vegetable products. 

The Packing Facility is a 176,000 square foot building where the various facilities and operations are centered. Adjacent accessory buildings and equipment provide support functions to the Packing Facility operations. Mechanical refrigeration systems are used in and adjacent to the Packing Facility to obtain the proper product temperature and to maintain the proper product temperature while the product is stored prior to shipping. Anhydrous ammonia is an effective refrigerant that has been used for many years by many food processing facilities. Ammonia is normally a gas at ambient temperatures but is handled as a gas liquefied under pressure. The refrigeration systems consist of pressure vessels, evaporators, compressors, piping and other refrigeration equipment.

Housed within the Packing Facility, System 1 is the largest refrigeration system onsite. System 1 provides refrigeration for the main cold storage rooms and for other cooling equipment located inside the Packing Facility.

Located on the north side of the Packing Facility, Systems 3, 4, and 5 are smaller, separate, refrigeration systems that provide refrigeration for chilled water and vacuum cooling operations. These Systems are separate processes utilizing a combination of mobile and fixed refrigeration equipment.

Summary of the Emergency Response Program:
Duda Farm Fresh Foods, in coordination with Dandy Cooling, maintains an Emergency Action Plan that was prepared in order to improve responsiveness to an emergency incident, and to increase the reliability of actions taken during an incident. The plan includes all aspects of emergency action and evacuation including adequate first aid, evacuations, and notification of local emergency response agencies.  In the event of an emergency involving a release of ammonia, it is the policy of the Facility to respond in a defensive manner as well as request assistance as necessary by calling the Palm Beach County fire department and hazmat team.  

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:  
Duda Farm Fresh Foods and Dandy Cooling are working together to improve and ensure the safety of their employees and community. Dandy Cooling will operate and maintain the Packing Facility refrigeration processes (or Systems) in accordance with IIAR Guidance. Duda Farm Fresh Foods and Dandy Cooling will continue to jointly implement the OSHA PSM Program in conjunction with the EPA Risk Management Program.  Implementation of these programs is a continuous improvement process toward improved safety.

corner of the Packing Facility, System 2, the Ice House, was decommissioned in 2020. It is mentioned here for historic reference, for those who might review the older PSM/RMP documentation. The Ice House structure remains, but is only used for dry storage.

Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:
Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc. is committed to promoting safety for the plant, its employees and the surrounding area. The Facility is complying with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard, Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations 1910.110 and EPA's Risk Management Program Title 40 CFR Part 68. The purpose of these programs is to ensure that the refrigeration systems are operated safely in order to prevent releases of ammonia. In addition, these programs serve to define emergency procedures in the event of a release.

Summary of the General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:
Duda Farm Fresh Foods, Inc. has established a Process Safety Management (PSM) program in accordance with OSHA regulations.  This PSM program serves to prevent accidental releases of ammonia. The program elements include:

	Process Safety Information
	Process Hazard Analysis 
	Operating Procedures 
	Training
	Mechanical Integrity 
	Management of Change 
	Pre Startup Safety Review 
	Compliance Audits
	Incident Investigation
	Employee Participation
	Emergency Planning and Response
	Hot Work Permits
	Contractor Safety

Summary of the Five-Year Accident History:
No “accidents” as defined in the regulations have occurred in the past 5 years.  However, OSHA has posted the following information on their website:
